Directions.1: Whisk together the soy sauce, vinegar, honey, garlic powder, ground ginger, green onion, and vegetable oil in a bowl; pour into a resealable plastic bag. Add the flank steak, coat with the marinade, squeeze out excess air, and seal the bag. Marinate in the refrigerator at least 4 hours.

Directions.2: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat, and lightly oil the grate.

Directions.3: Remove the flank steak from the marinade and shake off excess. Pour the remaining marinade into a small saucepan and set aside.

Directions.4: Cook the flank steak on the preheated grill until it begins to firm, and is reddish-pink and juicy in the center, about 5 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 130 degrees F (54 degrees C). Once cooked, cover the steak with several sheets of aluminum foil, and set aside to rest for 10 minutes before slicing thinly against the grain.

Directions.5: While the steak is resting, bring the marinade to a boil over medium-high heat. Pour the sauce over the sliced steak to serve.
